messages: eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:02): a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc: do you have any 404's in your manifest file?
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:02): also, add NETWORK: *
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:03): hi eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 ...
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:03): hey
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:03): The problem is that as soon as I access the website
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:03): the browser try to chache the address
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:04): ok
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:04): I don't know how to solve this issue
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:04): i'm not getting the problem.
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:05): CACHE MANIFEST
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:05): CACHE:
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:05): http://xyz.com/images.php
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:05): NETWORK:
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:05): This is my cache manifest ok?
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:05): does images.php return an image?
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:06): in other words, how are you calling images.php to load images?
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:06): manifest should only be used to cache static files.
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:06): http://xyz.com/images.php?token=sdaksjhvgfv
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:06): i don't think that will work.
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:06): where the token value changes
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:06): yeah
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:06): well ... how can I cache images ?
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:06): unless you list all your tokens in the manifest file.
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:07): how many images do you have?
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:07): The BIG problem is that I'm working on a phonegap app ...
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:08): and I need to syncronyze the app on the phone to the one on the server ... for text it is ok ... but ... how to cache images ?
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:08): i gather your images change for each user?
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:08): ie: it's not a logo.png
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:08): like product images.
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:08): it is not a logo
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:08): yesss
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:08): I have a 'events' table
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:08): i cached my images in localStorage
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:09): you have to encode them to a base64 string, then store the string for offline retrieval.
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:10): i have an example on github
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:10): offline-app
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:10): Yes I got what you say
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:10): by the way
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:10): does manifest work on phonegaps apps?
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:10): it's more challenging if your images are on a different domain (ie: a cdn)
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:11): manifest should be supported by the mobile device, yes.
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:11): i don't know about phonegap, because those are for native apps.
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:12): because on manifest you usually provide relative urls ... for resources of your app
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:12): but your app is stored locally ...
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:12): It is a little bit confusing ...
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:13): Another thing ... is it possible to download data to the app folder?
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:14): i'm only familar with mobile web.
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:14): try #phonegap
a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc (18:14): thanks for your help
c76d102bdf98e28f21e83331d783063c (18:16): hello, I'm wondering if header around h2 isn't redundant...
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:16): feel free to look at my example.
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:17): c76d102bdf98e28f21e83331d783063c: do you have a header -> h1 ?
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:17): i would use header as a div to wrap topnav, logo, etc.
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:17): which may also contain an h1
c76d102bdf98e28f21e83331d783063c (18:18): I'm seeing examples of header wrapping each article title
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:18): but typically i would put h1 in section on the content area.
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:19): well, you can do that too, but if all you have is an H1 tag then it is redudnant in my opinion.
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:20): a5cfd03a87a40d2d13f640c153aa41bc: https://github.com eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18/offline-app
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:27): if i had an image and a heading, i would use <header>
c76d102bdf98e28f21e83331d783063c (18:28): I suspect it will take the place of div id="header" which I often use
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:29): yeah
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:29): or class=header
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:30): it's handy. you can define header in section, article, body, etc.
c76d102bdf98e28f21e83331d783063c (18:34): after all h in h2, h3 stands for header
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (18:35): eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18: this looks rad
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:39): thanks
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (18:58): seems to be my passion, developing prototypes.
eb4fd75d7c504913a3dfa2895fbaeb18 (19:15): i hate when i do svn revert when I really mean svn diff.

8485d8e602b5c8ed48da0a6c8937c47b (19:27): hope it's ok to ask an html5boilerplate question... does anyone know how to tell ant to concat js but not minify?
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (19:27): you'll have to edit the .xml
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (19:28): you might be able to remove a talk towards the top
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (19:28): otherwise just yank that minify part out

4803bcc7f892507b5ccd53723fd240c1 (19:28): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049, I thought I knew your name from somewhere, but couldn't point my finger on it. Now I realized. Modernizr! Nice work with that btw. It's going to land me a new job soon ;)
8485d8e602b5c8ed48da0a6c8937c47b (19:29): thanks paul. i'll take a look there.
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (19:30): ugh
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (19:30): which windows media players support mpeg-4 natively?
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (19:30): I am not talking about browseres
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (19:31): but users downloading MP4 files
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (19:31): I assume Vista+
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (19:31): because IE9 does it
4803bcc7f892507b5ccd53723fd240c1 (19:32): 0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf, MP4 doesn't automatically mean MPEG-4 ;)

5d5b78699e57104f2fa03bbdf7b9197b (19:42): by marienz!~marienz@freenode/staff/marienz on Wed Aug 10 22:18:05
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (19:45): what's the thing with html5 and namespaces?
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (19:45): e.g. facebook fb
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (19:45): how are they supported or can I stick in arbitary namespaces?
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (19:45): facebook has changed
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (19:45): so no need namespaces
0acb83f1a9cfc48f061ff5555e61c6bf (19:46): I can change the example, but html5 and namespaces question remain :)
